farm.translation[0].definitions[0].defin: an area of land used for growing crops or keeping animals
farm.translation[0].definitions[0].examp: Joe had worked on the farm all his life.
He runs a pig farm in Lincolnshire.
farm.translation[0].definitions[1].defin: the main house on a farm where the farmer lives
farm.translation[0].note_box[0].sections: He bought a 300-hectare farm in Shropshire.
A pig farm in Dorset is the suspected source of the epidemic.
Checks are made on milk from local dairy farms.
Tractors represent the single biggest cost on most arable farms.
He lives on a fruit farm and helps to pick apples.
Organic farms can be as productive as industrial farming.
Pigs in factory farms are fed a mixture of grains and proteins.
We rely on migrant farm workers to pick the crop.
The cottages were built for the farm labourers.
The farmhouse is separated by hedges from other farm buildings.
It is used mainly for feeding farm animals.
In the field, there was a tractor and some other farm machinery.
Moldova provides Russia with large quantities of farm produce.
I used to work on a farm when I was younger.
She lives on a farm in Wiltshire.
He manages a large dairy farm.
The family owned a small farm in Suffolk.
They grew wheat and barley on their farm.
farm.translation[0].note_box[1].sections: an area of land, used for growing crops or keeping animals
a very large farm in the western US, Canada, or South America where sheep, cattle, or horses are bred
a piece of land used for farming, that is smaller than an ordinary farm
a smallholding used for organic farming
a large area of land in a hot country, where crops such as tea, cotton, and sugar are grown
a piece of land for farming that was given to people in the past by the US and Canadian governments
He still farms on the family homestead, a hundred years after his grandfather received it.
an area of land used for farming or ranching
They have a pretty big spread just south of the Canadian border.
an area of land, often with greenhouses on it, used for growing vegetables and fruit
He runs his own market garden, and sells his produce to the big supermarkets.
an area of land with trees, used for growing fruit
a small area of land of land, especially in a town or city, which you can use for growing your own vegetables.The land is usually owned by the local council, who charge a very low rent
We grew the tomatoes on our allotment.
More than 75% of the land is used for agriculture.
farm.translation[1].definitions[0].defin: to use land for growing crops or keeping animals
farm.translation[1].definitions[0].examp: The family has farmed here for generations.
The land has been farmed organically since 1995.
farm.translation[2].definitions[0].defin: an area of land, used for growing crops or keeping animals as a business
farm.translation[2].definitions[0].examp: Farm exports account for 70% of New Zealandâ€™s exports.
a dairy farm (=one producing milk and milk products)
farm.translation[2].definitions[1].defin: a place where particular fish or animals are bred as a business
farm.translation[3].definitions[0].defin: to use land for growing crops, keeping animals etc
farm.translation[3].definitions[0].examp: His family has been farming the same land for generations.
